Yuru: "There is no consensus among speakers and researchers whether the location words such as 里li should be considered as nouns or postpositions. 桶-里tong-li can be lit. 'bucket's-inside' or 'bucket-in'. According to my intuition, it would be better to choose the former one. This is to say that 里li  might be better considered as noun. In conclusion, it might be better to say "54 is not included in the database because X is expressed as an NP-internal modifier". [I-de hand have clf gasoline-smell]) is a noun and qiyou 'gasoline' functions as a NP-modifier. Yuru: "要 yào is more like a modal verb means 'need' and it literally doesn't have anything to do with the meaning 'cost'. 花huā is the semantic head of this predicate means 'cost'. But the verb 花huā can only have an agent as its subject, for example 我 花 了 十-块 钱 wǒ huā le shí-kuài qián 'I spent ten yuan.' So it will not be good enough to say that only 花huā 'cost' is the equivalent of the predicate 100 because the subject is a cup. In this case it might be better to identify the predicate as 要花 yàohuā."

""The predicate can be expressed with the simple TR pattern (SVO order) or ba-construction (SOV order). Ba is a marker for moving the object before the verb. It is sometimes difficult to decide whether ba-construction is conditioned by a broad grammatical rule, because some predicates will be ungrammatical without the ba-construction. In this sentence, both of the alternatives are acceptable, but the ba-version sounds more natural to me."

As to the expression of location in my translational equivalent, there is also no consensus among speakers and researchers whether the location words such as  should be considered as nouns or postpositions due to lack of case marking in Mandarin. 水-中 shuǐ-zhōng can be lit.  'water-middle' or 'water-in'. According to my intuition, it would be better to choose the former one. In conclusion, it might be better to say "54 is not included in the database because X is expressed as an NP-internal modifier". However, the possibility that 中zhōng can be a postposition should not be excluded. But either way I feel it would be quite unnatural and to use a simple noun 水shuǐ 'water' as the object.

Kolpachkova's alternative was "Wang Gang zai xiangshou re cha". But 享受xiangshou can only take abstract nouns as its object, for example 这-段 时光zhè-duàn shíguāng 'this-CLF time'. But 热茶recha 'hot tea' and this verb don't go together.
sentence_original_orthography: 张三 享受 着 热-茶-的 暖意。
张三 想要 一-部 新 手机。

comms_internal: CV. In Kolpachkova's data ithe predicate was shengqi, and the pattern was SBJ_dui
sentence_original_orthography: 张三 和 李四 有 积怨。

comms: Not included in the dataset because Y cannot be overtly expressed.
comms_internal: Kolpachkova's alternative was "Wang Gang baoyuan Yang Lan". But 抱怨baoyuan means literally 'complain', which is to say sth. to sb. because you are unhappy or not satisfied about sth. It doesn't mean 'take offence'.
sentence_original_orthography: 张三 感到 被 冒犯 了。

comms: Here, "ràng" is treated as an argument-marking device, but its status is controversial.
comms_internal: Yuru: "Co-verbs in Mandarin Chinese (incl. ràng) are more like prepositions with the meaning of verbs. So it is difficult for me to gloss 让Rang, which may be considered a preposition with the meaning 'make' or 'let'.  Both are found in literatures."
sentence_original_orthography: 张三 让 李四 很 心烦。
张三 对 这-座 城镇 惊叹-不-已。
张三 鄙视 李四。

comms: Non-verbal predicate.
back_translation_en: ‘Zhangsan is upset because of his son.’
sentence_original_orthography: 张三 因 他-儿子 而 心烦。

sentence: Zhāngsān kuài bèi tā-nǚ'ér jīnù le
glosses_en: PN soon BEI he-daughter irritate PFV
back_translation_en: ‘Zhangsan is getting irritated with his daughter.’
comms_internal: This is a labile verb. Kolpachkova's alternative was i) Cf. Wang Gang dui ta nver you fa piqi  (SBJ_dui)
sentence_original_orthography: 张三 快 被 他-女儿 激怒 了。
张三 很 喜欢 李四。

sentence: Zhāngsān yīn gèzi ǎi ér gǎndào nánkān
glosses_en: PN because_of height short so feel embarrassed
back_translation_en: ‘Zhangsan feels embarrassed because he is short.’
comms_internal: Not included in the dataset because the added material disrupts the direct syntactic relations between either argument (X or Y).
sentence_original_orthography: 张三 因 个子 矮 而 感到 难堪。
